metadata.title: paper | Apple Developer Documentation
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: This is an Apple Developer Documentation page for the 'paper' type property in WidgetKit's WidgetTexture structure. It describes a matte, paper-like texture available for widget coating layers on visionOS 26.0+, and is part of the broader WidgetKit framework documentation for updating widgets for visionOS.

pages.pageSummary: This page documents the 'paper' type property of the WidgetTexture structure in Apple's WidgetKit framework. The page is presented in a dark theme with a three-column layout: a left sidebar navigation showing the WidgetKit documentation hierarchy, a main content area with the API documentation, and a comprehensive footer with links to all Apple Developer resources. The main content describes 'paper' as a matte, paper-like texture for widget coating layers, available on visionOS 26.0+, and references the related 'glass' texture.

crossPageElements.runningHeaders: Developer Documentation navigation bar with Apple logo and main navigation links
crossPageElements.runningFooters: Comprehensive footer with platform links, tools, resources, and legal information

semanticStructure.documentFlow: The document follows Apple's standard API documentation format: breadcrumb navigation establishes context within the WidgetKit framework, followed by the type classification (Type Property), the main heading (paper), a brief description, platform availability badge, the Swift code declaration, cross-references to mentioning articles, and related APIs (the glass texture). The left sidebar provides hierarchical navigation through the entire WidgetKit framework, while the footer provides comprehensive access to all Apple Developer resources.

keyTerms.definition: A matte, paper-like texture for the widget's coating layer
A SwiftUI type representing textures that can be applied to widget coating layers
A reflective, clear glass-like texture for the widget's coating layer
Apple's operating system for spatial computing devices (Vision Pro)
The visual surface layer of a widget that can have textures applied
Apple's framework for building widgets across Apple platforms

keyFindings: The 'paper' texture is a static type property on the WidgetTexture structure
This API requires visionOS 26.0 or later
There are two widget texture options: 'paper' (matte) and 'glass' (reflective)
This API is specifically designed for updating widgets for visionOS spatial computing
The texture affects the widget's 'coating layer' - its visual surface appearance

designDecisions.rationale: Offers visual contrast to the reflective glass texture option, allowing developers to choose widget appearance that fits their app's design
Widget textures are designed for spatial computing environments where material appearance is particularly important for UI depth and legibility
